revised_title: Lunar Mare Formation and Filling: Absolute Time Scale and Geological Implications
tldr: This article investigates the absolute time scale of lunar mare formation and filling using radiometric dating techniques. The authors find that high-titanium basalts in maria Tranquillitatis and Serenitatis are older (3.6-3.4 Ga) than low-titanium basalts in Mare Imbrium and Oceanus Procellarum (3.1-3.4 Ga). The study provides insights into the Moon's thermal history, differentiation processes, and the evolution of its surface.
